item.title: Dynamic programming
item.description: The essential idea of dynamic programming is to save the result for future use. For example, if I have already know 1+2+3 equals 6 and saved the result at a place, then when I have to calculate 1+2+3+4, I just have to calculate 6+4 instead of going from scratch.
